title: Discussing an artist selling out
context: Complain that a band changed their style just to make more money.

content.bestLine: They totally sold out, their new sound is so fake

neutral.text: I'm not a fan of their new direction
The band's style has become more commercial
Their new album lacks the edge of their previous work
The artist's priorities seem to have shifted
Their music is now more mainstream
The band has lost their originality

informal.text: I don't recognize their new sound
They're just making music for the money now
Their new album is a total disappointment
I'm so over their new music
They're just trying to fit in now
Their music is so generic now

slang.text: Their new sound is hella lame
They're just chasing that dough now
Their music is straight fire... said no one
Their new album is a total banger... not

sarcastic.text: Oh great, another album that sounds just like everything else
I'm so impressed by their new commercial sound
They've really stayed true to their roots... said no one
Their music is still so edgy and unique

patterns.meaning: changed their music style for financial gain
their music has become less original and more mainstream

dialogs.description: Two friends discussing a band's new album

lines.speaker: Friend 1
lines.text: Have you heard their new album?

lines.speaker: Friend 2
lines.text: Yeah, it's so different from their old stuff. They've totally sold out.

dialogs.description: A group of people talking about a band's change in style

lines.speaker: Person 1
lines.text: I don't get why they had to change their sound

lines.speaker: Person 2
lines.text: They probably did it for the money

lines.speaker: Person 3
lines.text: Yeah, their new music is so mainstream now. It's like they're trying to fit in or something.
